title: Pride of Britain Awards: TOWIE's Chloe Sims puts on a busty display
text:
She regularly turns heads with her daring ensembles.

And Chloe Sims ensured all eyes were on her as she walked the red carpet at the Pride of Britain Awards held at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London on Monday.

It was a family evening out for the TOWIE star, 36, as she was joined by her younger sister Demi, 23, and their cousin Joey Essex, 29, at the star-studded event.

Stunning: Chloe Sims, 36, ensured all eyes were on her as she walked the red carpet at the Pride of Britain Awards held at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London on Monday

Chloe looked radiant in a shimmering sleeveless dress with a plunging neckline and a detailed bejeweled embellishment.

The garment also featured a sheer pleated detail while Chloe added height to her frame with a pair of silver heels.

Displaying her sun-kissed glow, Chloe added further glamour to her look with diamond earrings and styled her blonde locks into loose waves.

Demi cut a stylish figure for the event in a white sleeveless dress with a plunging necline and a detailed embroidered embellishment.

Family: It was a family evening out for Chloe as she was joined by her younger sister Demi, 23, and their cousin Joey Essex, 29, at the star-studded event.

Letting her platinum blonde locks fall loose down her shoulders, Demi added to her outfit with a clutch bag.

Joey looked dapper for the awards show, walking the red carpet in a black blazer with matching trousers and bow tie which he paired with a white shirt.

Chloe's best pal and fellow TOWIE star Pete Wicks was also in attendance at the event where he donned a grey check blazer with a matching waistcoat.

The reality veteran paired it with a white shirt and black trousers while letting his trademark long locks fall loose down his shoulders.

Style: Chloe looked radiant in a shimmering sleeveless dress with a plunging neckline and a detailed bejeweled embellishment

Pete recently admitted he feels incredibly protective towards Chloe and is pleased to see her date Pamela Anderson’s ex Adil Rami.

The mother-of-one made headlines a few weeks ago when she was seen leaving London hotspot Chiltern Firehouse in the company of the dashing football star.

Throwing his support behind their unlikely romance, Pete told MailOnline: ‘I wasn’t surprised, I knew she was going on a date. I know she had a good time.

'I think he lives in a different country so I don’t know when they’re planning on seeing each other again.’

Adil parted ways with Pamela this summer following her allegations of 'mental abuse' and accusations of violence and cheating - all of which he has strenuously denied.

Fashion: Demi cut a stylish figure for the event in a white sleeveless dress with a plunging necline and a detailed embroidered embellishment

Meanwhile, Chloe has had a tough year after her ill-fated romance with co-star Dan Edgar left her heartbroken when he went crawling back to his ex Amber Turner.

Feeling like a protective big brother, Pete said: ‘Chloe deserves to be happy and whatever makes her happy, I’m there for.

‘I am quite protective over Chloe, she has been messed around a bit and she deserves all the happiness in the world. Hopefully, one day she’ll find her prince charming!’

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars will come together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

Dapper: Chloe's best pal and fellow TOWIE star Pete Wicks was also in attendance at the event where he donned a grey check blazer with a matching waistcoat

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started. In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will be broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
